content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize empty string to store extracted code
    code = ""

    # Loop through each line of the markdown document
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # If current line is a julia code fence, append previous code block and reset the new code block
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            code = join([code, lines[i-1]], "\n")
            code = ""
        elseif startswith(line, "```") && endswith(lines[i+1], "```") # If current line is a closing code fence and next line is an opening code fence, append previous code block and reset the new code block
            code = join([code, lines[i-1]], "\n")
            code = ""
        elseif !startswith(line, "```") # If current line is not a code fence, append it to the current code block
            code *= line*"\n"
        end
    end

    # Return extracted julia code
    return code
end
```

This function works by first splitting the markdown document into lines. It then initializes an empty string `code` which will store the extracted julia code blocks. The function loops through each line of the markdown document, checking if it is a julia code fence (starts with "```julia") or a closing code fence (ends with "```"). If a line is identified as either a code fence or a closing code fence, the previous code block is appended to `code` and reset. If a line is not a code fence or a closing code fence, it is appended to the current code block. The function then returns the extracted julia code.
